name: brazilwood
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a tree found in Brazil with orange-red wood that is used to make dye and parts of string instruments: As the brazilwood stands were cut down, they were replaced with sugarcane plantations. Brazilwood trees are endangered in Brazil.
[ U ] the wood of the brazilwood tree, which is used to make parts of string instruments: The bow is traditionally made of brazilwood. The cello came with a beautiful brazilwood bow.
[ U ] a red dye made from brazilwood: They have exploited the traditional wisdom about natural dyes, including indigo, cochineal and brazilwood. Brazilwood dyes can range from deep crimson to pink.
More examplesFewer examplesThe country Brazil is named after the brazilwood tree.The box had an attractive brazilwood veneer.Brazilwood was a very popular dye and gave rise to a profitable trade for the Portuguese colonists.
